CssPseudo.name: ::before(2)
CssPseudo.description: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately before the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The number parameter is used when multiple '::before()' functions are used in conjunction. The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

CssPseudo.name: ::after(2)
CssPseudo.description: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately after the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The number parameter is used when multiple '::after()' functions are used in conjunction. The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

CssPseudo.name: ::outside
CssPseudo.description: An '::outside' pseudo-element is one that is generated immediately outside the pseudo-element's superior.

CssPseudo.name: ::outside(2)
CssPseudo.description: An '::outside' pseudo-element is one that is generated immediately outside the pseudo-element's superior. When given a parameter, '::outside(n)' represents an nth pseudo-element generated immediately around the n-1th pseudo-element.

CssPseudo.name: ::alternate
CssPseudo.description: This pseudo-element is created by setting its 'move-to' property to an identifier. It is rendered at the next occurrence of 'pending()' in a 'content' property.

CssPseudo.name: ::marker
CssPseudo.description: For a '::marker' pseudo-element to be generated, its superior parent must have a computed 'display' value of 'list-item'.

CssPseudo.name: ::line-marker
CssPseudo.description: The '::line-marker' pseudo-element is positioned in exactly the same way as the '::marker' pseudo-element, but appears on every line, not just the first.

CssProperty.name: crop
CssProperty.description: Allows a replaced element to be just a rectangular area of an object, instead of the whole object.

entry.description: The element's computed intrinsic width and height are the same as its actual intrinsic width and height.

Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the top left of the element.

Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the respective edges of the element.

CssProperty.name: move-to
CssProperty.description: Property causes the element or pseudo-element to be removed from the flow and reinserted at a later point in the document.

entry.description: For '::alternate' pseudo-elements, if the superior parent uses the 'footnote' counter in its 'content' property then the computed value of 'move-to' is 'footnotes'.
The element or pseudo-element is not moved. This value inhibits the creation of '::alternate' pseudo-elements and any pseudo-elements that have such a pseudo-element as a superior.

CssProperty.name: quotes
CssProperty.description: Specifies quotation marks for any number of embedded quotations.

entry.description: The 'open-quote' and 'close-quote' values of the 'content' property produce no quotations marks, as if they were 'no-open-quote' and 'no-close-quote' respectively.

CssProperty.name: counter-increment
CssProperty.description: Counters are used with the 'counter()' and 'counters()' functions of the the 'content' property.

entry.description: The counter is not modified.

CssProperty.name: counter-reset
CssProperty.description: Property accepts one or more names of counters (identifiers), each one optionally followed by an integer. The integer gives the value that the counter is set to on each occurrence of the element.

entry.description: The counter is not modified.

CssProperty.name: page-policy
CssProperty.description: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

entry.description: Takes the value of the counter or string at the beginning of the page (before applying style to the elements of the page, but after applying it to the @page context itself).
Takes the value after the first state change in the counter or string during processing of the page.
Takes the value following the final state change on the page.

CssAtDirective.name: counter
CssAtDirective.description: Authors may use @counter declaration blocks and the 'page-policy' property, which applies only to strings and counters.

CssAtDirective.name: string
CssAtDirective.description: Authors may use @string declaration blocks and the 'page-policy' property, which applies only to strings and counters.

CssProperty.name: content
CssProperty.description: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

entry.description: See http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-content/#content for computation rules.

On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements it causes the pseudo-element to have no content.

On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements, this inhibits the creation of the pseudo-element, as if 'display' computed to 'none'.
Displays the element's descendents.
Shorthand for 'counter(footnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a footnote.
Shorthand for 'counter(endnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a endnote.
Shorthand for 'counter(section-note, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a section-note.

Shorthand for 'counter(list-item, normal)'. Note that this is not equivalent to 'normal' when set on a '::marker' pseudo-element that has a superior with 'display' set to 'list-item', as it ignores the 'list-style' properties.
Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.
Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.
Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.
Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.
A hollow square.
A check mark.
A hollow circle.
A filled diamond. On some platforms, this is similar to 'disc'.
A filled circle.
A hyphen bullet.
A filled square.
The attr(n) function returns as a string the value of attribute n for the subject of the selector
Current date and/or time, formatted according to the specified formatting string. Format is based on POSIX date formatting strings.
Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).
Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).
Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).
Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).
Specifies a string value
This causes all elements and pseudo-elements whose 'move-to' property computes to the specified identifier to be inserted as children of the current element (or pseudo-element).
